diff_hunk:
@@ -209,6 +210,7 @@ def tf_copts(android_optimization_level_override="-O2", is_external=False):
       + if_tensorrt(["-DGOOGLE_TENSORRT=1"])
       + if_mkl(["-DINTEL_MKL=1", "-DEIGEN_USE_VML"])
       + if_mkl_lnx_x64(["-fopenmp"])
+      + if_mkl_darwin(["-Xpreprocessor", "-fopenmp"])
body:
I tried your test command got the results passed as below in our local environment.
I guessed  you used xcode version clang that would meet this errors. Our PR is to support default macos toolchain using openmp. seems you need to switch the command line toolchain . Here are some tips to help you.

1.	Open the “Terminal.app”, type “xcode-select --install”, and click “install” in the popup window.
2.	Type “sudo xcode-select -s /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools” to switch the build chain for cmd.

body_html:
I tried your test command got the results passed as below in our local environment.
I guessed you used xcode version clang that would meet this errors. Our PR is to support default macos toolchain using openmp. seems you need to switch the command line toolchain . Here are some tips to help you.

  1. Open the “Terminal.app”, type “xcode-select --install”, and click “install” in the popup window.
  2. Type “sudo xcode-select -s /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools” to switch the build chain for cmd.

body_text:
I tried your test command got the results passed as below in our local environment.
I guessed  you used xcode version clang that would meet this errors. Our PR is to support default macos toolchain using openmp. seems you need to switch the command line toolchain . Here are some tips to help you.

Open the “Terminal.app”, type “xcode-select --install”, and click “install” in the popup window.
Type “sudo xcode-select -s /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools” to switch the build chain for cmd.
